item.title: A gradient model for the Bernstein polynomial basis
item.description: arXiv:2411.15954v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We introduce and study a symmetric, gradient exclusion process, in the class of non-cooperative kinetically constrained lattice gases, modelling a non-linear diffusivity where mass transport is constrained by the local density not being too small or too large. Maintaining the gradient property is the main technical challenge. The resulting model enjoys of properties in common with the Bernstein polynomial basis, and is associated with the diffusion coefficient $D_{n,k}(\rho)=\binom{n+k}{k}\rho^n(1-\rho)^k$, for $n,k$ arbitrary natural numbers. The dynamics generalizes the Porous Media Model, and we show, via the entropy method, the hydrodynamic limit for the empirical measure associated with a perturbed, irreducible version of the process. The hydrodynamic equation is proved to be a Generalized Porous Media Equation.
